data.title: John William Boone
data.meta_description: Genealogy for John William Boone (1755 - 1835)  family tree on Geni, with over 260 million profiles of ancestors and living relatives.
data.text:
https://ancestors.familysearch.org/en/LVDQ-4C3/nancy-boone-1791-1885

Daughter of American Revolution Ancestor #: A012114

Service: PENNSYLVANIA Rank: PRIVATE

Birth: 1755 YORK CO PENNSYLVANIA

Death: 7-17-1835 MONROE CO VIRGINIA

Pension Number: *SR1017

Service Source: *SR1017

Service Description: 1) CAPT SPANGLER, GEN GATES

Rev. War Pension Record # R1017 from the National Archives. This document establishes his service in the Rev. war, his year and place of birth, his year of marriage, wife, children battles fought in and relationship to Daniel Boone(uncle). For his service he received a land grant in 1794 in what was Greenbrier Co., Virginia. It was located at the mouth of Howard's creek, where it joins the Greenbrier River.

Contents of the Revolutionary War Record of John Boon of Monroe Co., Virginia. The record number is R 1017 from the National Archives veterans records.

Page 1 John Boon of Monroe Co. in the State of Va who was a Pri in the company commanded by Captain Spangler of the --- commanded by --- in the Pennsylvania line for 2 years

He enlisted in 1777 in York County, PA for the Revolutionary War and served three years in Captain Spangler's Pennsylvania Company. Before his army duty and his marriage he went to Kentucky with his uncle Daniel Boone returning in 1774 to York.

Jacob Boone Sr., an out of wedlock son of Catharine Coger, was

born in Franklin County VA in 1805. Family tradition says that his

father was a son of the legendary Daniel Boone. He married Martha

Sands, a daughter of Mathew and Levisa (Fields) Sands, who was born

August 5, 1811 in Nicholas County VA (WV) and died July 28, 1897 in

Gilmer County, WV.
